repo.name: aichat
repo.description: All-in-one LLM CLI tool featuring Shell Assistant, Chat-REPL, RAG, AI Tools & Agents, with access to OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, Ollama, Groq, and more.

readme.summary: Excellent overview with clear installation and comprehensive features, but lacks inline quick-start example and troubleshooting guidance in the main README.
readme.top_issue: No immediate quick-start code example in README - users must understand concepts before seeing actual usage syntax

injection_risks.description: The `shell_execute` function executes a command with user input using the `run_command` function, which may lead to shell injection attacks.
The `call_chat_completions` and `call_chat_completions_streaming` functions are called with user input, which may lead to potential injection risks if the input is not properly sanitized.

critical_findings: Potential shell injection attacks due to unsanitized user input
Lack of validation for user input in some cases
security.summary: The code has potential security risks, including shell injection attacks and lack of input validation, but overall it appears to be well-structured and follows best practices.

common_complaints: No releases for extended period despite fixes being available
API compatibility issues with newer Claude models (Opus 4.5)
Tool call handling broken for OpenAI-compatible endpoints
File globbing only processes first file
Configuration management across devices is cumbersome
Platform-specific binary issues (illegal instruction on i686)
praise_themes: User appreciation for the project and maintainer
Recognition as best CLI client for LLMs
sentiment.summary: Active community with engaged users requesting features, but slow maintainer responsiveness and a 5+ month release gap causing frustration around critical bug fixes and API compatibility.

red_flags: repeated 'we will not support this feature' responses without explanation
dismissal of user issues with 'cannot reproduce' without further investigation
communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are technically proficient but often lack patience and welcomingness, with a tendency to dismiss user requests and issues without thorough explanation or consideration.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2026-01-06)
Zero closed issues in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
maintenance.summary: The aichat package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity for 6 months and a large backlog of unresolved issues.

project_metrics.description: All-in-one LLM CLI tool featuring Shell Assistant, Chat-REPL, RAG, AI Tools & Agents, with access to OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, Ollama, Groq, and more.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is comprehensive and well-structured, but could benefit from more concise quick start examples and better troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: Docs: Lack of clear troubleshooting section or FAQ that addresses common problems and solutions
Community: feature requests not being addressed
Communication: repeated 'we will not support this feature' responses without explanation
Communication: dismissal of user issues with 'cannot reproduce' without further investigation
Security: Potential shell injection attacks due to unsanitized user input
Security: Lack of validation for user input in some cases
Security: The `shell_execute` function executes a command with user input using the `run_command` function, which may lead to shell injection attacks.
High bus factor risk (96% from top contributor)
